alternate_name: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis, Lou Gehrig's Disease
description:
The ALS Association Florida Chapter was co-founded by patient Ann Smith in-u00e1August of 1987-u00e1as the Tampa Bay Chapter to serve the needs of those living with Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (also known as Lou Gehrig's disease) and their caregivers.-u00e1In 2001, the-u00e1Tampa Bay Chapter-u00e1expanded its services to all areas in the state of Florida and became known as the Florida Chapter. 

The ALS Association is the only national not-for-profit health organization dedicated solely to-u00e1the fight against ALS. The ALS Association covers all the bases: to help people living with Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis and to leave no stone unturned in search for the cure. Works together to accomplish our mission to find a cure for ALS while empowering the lives of those living with ALS through Care, Advocacy, Research, Education and Support.-u00e1Programs include support groups, case management, respite care, medical equipment loan, educational services, and national and state advocacy.

name: ALS ASSOCIATION FLORIDA CHAPTER
